q: The others voting against Ben Bernanke were: Republicans Jim Bunning of Kentucky, Sen. Jim DeMint of South Carolina, David Vitter of Louisiana, Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison of Texas and Mike Crapo of Idaho. The sole dissenting Democrat was Jeff Merkley of Oregon. We can't have a Federal Reserve that the majority of Americans no longer trust, and that's what we have today, said Sen. Jim DeMint . So dissatisfied by the bailouts, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent liberal from Vermont, wants to block the nomination on the Senate floor. He has placed a "hold" on the nomination,

judge and new CNN talkshow host told Metro that he was shocked by the powerful position to which the the Liberal Democrat leader has since risen. Asked who were his most difficult interviewees, Piers Morgan said: Ones who emerge as fairly imbecilic. Nick Clegg stands out; my GQ interview with him was a series of spectacular own goals. "I thought,' I hope he never ends up running the country' and, whoa- here he is. How can this guy be so powerful? It's frightening. He added: " Simon Cowell was tough because we're friends but he was also my boss and he wouldn't be afraid to use that advantage- but it made for good TV." EastEnders:

I want everyone to relax and to know that I am here and we are all watching with open eyes. I want people to know that after days of protest, the monuments are safe. Why? Because the Egyptian people are protecting them, Zahi Hawass concluded. first-round series. "He was on fire," Hornets coach Paul Silas said of Allen Iverson , who fell eight points shy of Michael Jordan 's NBA playoff record set exactly 17 years ago in a double-overtime loss at Boston. Anytime a guy like that is on fire, there's very little you can do except to take the ball out of his hands. It's right up there with Michael Beasley 's 63. He just had a great night. The NBA saw some superlative performances over the opening weekend of the playoffs, but the best came in the last game. where he most recently worked with the company's Online Services "We are already making strong traction across our Server and Tools Business by embracing cloud services," said Microsoft chief executive Steve Ballmer . Satya Nadella has deep experience in both our server business and online services, which will help accelerate our momentum while setting the course to deliver the cloud computing scenarios of the future. The 19 year Microsoft veteran will take the reigns Microsoft's server, tools and cloud platforms from outgoing president Bob Muglia. In January, the company would be leaving Redmond later this year
